entry.title: do you ever get homesick? (i can't get used to it)
entry.summary:
Author: thoughtyouintomylife

Summary: Eddie pulls him into a hug and Buck suddenly can’t hold it in anymore, the words coming up his throat like vomit. “Eddie, I need to tell yo-”“Don’t,” Eddie interrupts, not pulling away and instead squeezing him tighter. “Don’t say it.”Buck frowns in confusion, moving out of his grip to look him in the eyes. “You don’t even know what I-”“I do know,” Eddie whispers, swallowing hard and looking down at the floor. “I know. But you can’t say it.”Buck studies him carefully and it only takes him a few seconds to realize that Eddie does in fact know what he was going to say. “Why not?” he whispers.“Because I’ll say it back,” Eddie answers slowly. “I’ll say it back because I do, and I don’t wanna do that to you, Buck. Not when I don’t know what’s going to...you deserve better than that.”ORBuck and Eddie grapple with knowing they’re in love and not being able to do anything about it.

entry.title: A job that slowly kills you, bruises that won't heal (I'll take a quiet life)
entry.summary:
Author: JasonToddsDevotedWife

Summary: ' Buck, speak of the devil, dropped down the last few feet. Bracing one foot against the rocky cliff and the other against the bumper, he secured his line and glanced up. The moment his eyes met Hondo’s, he faltered, foot slipping slightly against the rock.“You okay, kid?”It was impressive, the speed with which Buck recollected himself. Other than a slight downward quirk to his lips as though he had swallowed something sour, there was nothing on his face to tip off discomfort. An odd reaction, as far as he knew Buck had never met this man before. Eddie couldn’t help but furrow his brow. ' Evan "Buck" Buckley doesn't lie to his loved ones. At least, not any more than he needs to. He's made quite the life for himself at the 118 with people he loves and not a care in the world (at least, as far as anybody can tell) about his past before the 118. His past that he has historically been a bit vague about. When a blast from the past appears on a call, he is realizing that he might not have gotten away so scott-free from his past occupation. Cue Eddie noticing. Now, Buck has to navigate the collision between his past and his present.

entry.title: Be My Baby
entry.summary:
Author: a_simple_gaywitch

Summary: The last thing Buck expects is a baby dropped at his doorstep. But by god, he's going to step up to give this child the best life possible, with the help of his family at the 118. He just needs to take life one day at a time.Title from Be My Baby by The RonettesTags to be added

entry.title: Keeping It Quiet
entry.summary:
Author: bellabrady

Summary: He can’t handle standing next to Eddie for however long it takes to clean the engine, he just can’t. He’s going to lose it. And he’s going to lose Eddie, too, because he’ll inevitably either kiss him or confess his undying love. He can’t even guarantee he won’t just drop down on one knee and propose.“Oh, yeah, I’ll be right there, Bobby!” Buck yells before dropping his rag into the bucket and taking off towards the loft, leaving Eddie standing there dumbfounded.“Buck, no one was calling for you!” he shouts, exasperated. Buck ignores him and bounds up the stairs.—Or: Buck realizes he's in love with Eddie shortly before a 24 hour shift. Out of fear of accidentally confessing his love, Buck tries to avoid him at all costs. If only Eddie wasn't so derermined to talk to him.

entry.title: Once More (With Feeling)
entry.summary:
Author: Strawberrywaltz

Summary: “I told him you could help.” Christopher says with such confidence that Eddie’s heart jumps into his throat. Because to Eddie, this isn’t a fight he can win. “Please help him.”“Christopher.” Eddie whispers and looks back down at the likely dying wild animal his son brought home.“Please?” Christopher’s eyes are wide and wet and looking at him with such hope.What can Eddie do? Say no? Of course not. “I’ll try, but Mijo, it looks pretty hurt.”“You can save him.” Christopher insists. “I know you can.”__Or: Christopher saves a fox on a field trip that ends up not being a fox after all.

entry.title: Aftershock
entry.summary:
Author: MrsM

Summary: Buck never expected his past to catch up with him. After years of trying to build a new life, an unexpected new recruit threatens to unravel everything. Secrets, regrets, and unexpected connections force him to face the wreckage he thought he left behind. But sometimes, the real impact isn’t in the first quake—it’s in the aftershock.orBuck has tried to forget his time in El Paso, but he is forced to remember when the 118 gets a new probie, Eddie Diaz.

entry.title: Haunted by the ghost of you
entry.summary:
Author: Bumblebee2020

Summary: Evan Buckley has always been able to see ghosts, to the point if it weren't for his sister he would've been medicated.He meets Eddie Diaz when he's 22, they fall in love at 26, Eddie Diaz dies at 30 years old when a structure collapses."I can't see him Maddie, I...""Christopher?" Buck shakes his head as the weight in his chest grows. "You think maybe..."Buck shook his head harshly."No, he wouldn't without saying goodbye.... I haven't seen any of them since he died... it's like the world went quiet.""Buck..." Christopher whimpers as he walks into the living room. "I can't..."Buck nods and hugs him too, tight against his chest.~"I'm still here..."

entry.title: Shadows Of The Past
entry.summary:
Author: Queeny25

Summary: Buck struggles with his parents back in town. A little backstory, the Buckley parents were abusive but only to Buck, never Maddie she was their golden child. Maddie only found out about the abuse when she went to LA after running from Doug. Now in the present day Buck has made a family with the 118, and has an amazing boyfriend Eddie Diaz. Let’s see how Buck’s world gets turned upside down when he receives a text from Maddie stating that his parents are moving to LA.

entry.title: If I Could Take Us Back (If I Could Just Do That)
entry.summary:
Author: sleepless_nights_and_daydreams

Summary: “Will you write to me?” Chris asked out of nowhere as the credits rolled on the final episode.“Of course buddy, you know you can text me or call me any time” Buck responded quizzically, leaning over Chris’s legs to grab the remote and pause the TV. Chris was starting to grow out of cuddling on the sofa, but he still liked the physical contact, so Buck was sat in the middle of the sofa while Chris laid with his legs in Bucks lap.“No I know that but… no it’s stupid.” Chris mumbled in response.“Hey don’t say that, what's up?” Buck prompted “You know you can talk to me about anything.”--Eddie moves to El Paso, and Buck and Chris decide they're going to write letters to each other as a fun way to keep in touch.Buck decides on his own to write Eddie letters at the same time, but these are one's he'll never actually send. Because you don't send your platonic best friend love letters written on pink love heart paper.Until you do.

entry.title: if i’m not by your side (are you still on mine?)
entry.summary:
Author: amcnightingale

Summary: “So…there’s nothing going on there?” Eddie is biting his lip. He knows he’s the one avoiding looking at the camera now. A familiar pit is growing in his stomach that he can recognize as ugly, hot jealousy which isn’t even tempered by the relief he feels from Buck deliberately choosing not to share a bed with the man.“Me and Miguel? No way.” Buck laughs loudly, like the idea is ludicrous. Eddie doesn’t get what’s so funny. “Miguel’s straight as a board.”So was I, Eddie’s mind unpleasantly supplies. Until I wasn’t. or, Eddie has an inconvenient realization 800 miles away from Buck and is stuck spiraling after the new guy at the 118 seems to be replacing him in more ways than one.

entry.title: Holy Mother of God
entry.summary:
Author: ParadiseDarkness26

Summary: Eddie arrives in heaven, but God sends him back because he still has to accept that he's gay and likes Buck. When he returns, he kisses Buck, and God is left enjoying his tacos.

entry.title: Artifact of Time
entry.summary:
Author: Duochanfan

Summary: With Gerard as Captain, Buck and Eddie decide to keep their budding relationship on the down low. Especially after the way the man had singled Buck out when his relationship with Tommy had ended two months before. Now a month later, Gerard is still at the 118 with no sign of Bobby returning anytime soon. The Captain of the 118 tries to force Buck and Eddie into searching through a crumbling museum during a five-alarm fire, when both were trying to leave early to head down to El Paso to get Christopher back. When they refuse to search, Gerard goes on the attack and Buck and Eddie hit an artifact that takes their heart's desire into account and throws them back in time to the day they met.Character Death is Temporary!!! Time Travel fixes it!

entry.title: Don't Look Away
entry.summary:
Author: milowren

Summary: “Hey, do you guys think Eddie’s mad at me?”“Maybe he finally got tired of sharing that one braincell,” Chimney says from his spot on the couch. Next to him, Hen nods in agreement without looking up from the book she’s reading.“Ha ha, very funny,” Buck says, crossing the mezzanine to stand behind them. “I’m serious though — he’s hardly even looked at me in two days.”At that, Hen closes her book and cranes her neck to gaze at him over the back of the couch. “Did something happen?”“I don’t think so? He’s just been weird since that call the other day.”Hen furrows her brow. “What call?”“The one on the Hotshots set. You know, the guy on the ladder.” *** When Eddie starts acting weird around him after a call, Buck is determined to find out why.
